channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024080520
item.description:
Report E-2024080520

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel collected one (1) damaged pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crew deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263 paint impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and generated waste were collected and containerized into the same one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024081127
item.description:
Report X-2024081127

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THREE AIR PACKAGES FROM VIRGINIA TO THE UNITED KINGDOM WERE INSPECTED DUE TO THE THERMAL TRACKING LABELS AND INVOICE INDICATED NAIL POLISH WAS BEING SHIPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED VARIOUS FLAMMABLE NAIL FILLERS AND POLISHES IN THE SHIPMENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS IN THE SAME SHIPMENT CONTAINING FLAMMABLE PRODUCTS ARE 1Z35V2V26729716740 AND 1Z35V2V26726606927. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM VIRGINIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 35V2V2, DYBW, 660 HEMPSTEAD GARDENS DR, WEST HEMPSTEAD NY 11552-3730.

item.title: Report I-2024010059
item.description:
Report I-2024010059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T00:40:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: Petersburg
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: RSI LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/5/24 at approximately 10:00 AM, Operators were loading ethanol from railcar MUI-X 730192 into Petroleum Carriers trailer 9301. While loading a scheduled 1400 gallons into compartment 2(capacity 2500 gallons), product. was released from the overflow tubes at the rear of the trailer. The pump 0meter read 1272 gallons at the time of the release. An estimated 100 gallons impacted the asphalt. Product evaporated, there is no cleanup material to be disposed of. All appropriate personnel were notified of the incident. Overfill protection on the pump was disabled by the loaders. Driver failed to advise loaders that there was product remaining in the compartment being loaded.

item.title: Report X-2024081068
item.description:
Report X-2024081068

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-02
  • City: CHANTILLY
  • State: VA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE REWRAP WAS NEEDED FOR ONE AIR PACKAGE SHIPPING TO ANCHORAGE ALASKA. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X 5.2 OUNCE AEROSOL CAN OF FLAMMABLE ORIBE GOLD LUST DRY HEAT PROTECTION SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024080087
item.description:
Report X-2024080087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: CHESAPEAKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLF SOUTHERN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: VA State hazmat inspector noted a strong ethanol smell around TAEX 2630. He mounted the car and found the odor emitting from around the manway. A response contractor was called to investigate and repair the car. Contractor found the manway gasket was deteriorated with grooves and breaks in the gasket. The gasket was removed and replaced with a nozzle gasket.
